Module ben.partparty
Package ben.partparty.controller

Class MainViewController

java.lang.Object
ben.partparty.controller.MainViewController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
AddPartController
public class MainViewController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
Primary Controller - Initiates Child Controllers to handle each FXML file in the view directory. MainViewController -> AddPartController -> AddProductController -> ModifyProductController ^-> ModifyPartController FUTURE_ENHANCEMENT A check prior to deletion which prevents the user from deleting a part without first removing it as an associated part from a product could be added if parts were updated to include a list of "Associated Products". An implementation of this without updating part would create a runtime complexity of O(N^2) as a part would have to check all Products for all Asssociated Parts lists to confirm if it exists before proceeding to delete. FUTURE_ENHANCEMENT Relying on the FXML loader constrained normal object-oriented principals, exploring alternative options for displaying a GUI would greatly reduce redundant calls and methods, potentially allowing for all Controllers to be consolidated instead of using inheritance.

    • OnModifyItem

      public void OnModifyItem(javafx.event.ActionEvent modifyEvent) throws NullPointerException
      Loads ModifyProductView or ModifyPartView depending on which is clicked.
      Parameters:
      modifyEvent - ActionEvent containing UID of click, allows method to determine which view to open
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - RUNTIME_ERROR If an item has not been clicked inside the matching table to the "modify" button clicked, the system will not continue to loading the corresponding FXML file.

    • OnDeleteItem

      public void OnDeleteItem(javafx.event.ActionEvent delete) throws NullPointerException
      Handles deletion of either Part or Product
      Parameters:
      delete - the ActionEvent containing UID of click, allows method to determine table to check for a selection The inclusion of generics significantly reduced reused codes which were identical for both parts and products.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - RUNTIME_ERROR Before the button ID check placed in the line under the displayConfirmation, the method calls to this function were very verbose and required their own FXML loader, oftentimes this would create NullPointer and IOExceptions that required additional code to check for. The simple getId() function cut down on 10-15 lines of code and resolved the core issue.
      RuntimeException - RUNTIME_ERROR If a Product still has associated parts when selected for deletion.

      public Optional<javafx.scene.control.ButtonType> displayConfirmation(String itemName)
      Generic Confirmation Message which asks the user to confirm a remove action
      Parameters:
      itemName - the String name associated with the Delete or Remove Associated Part button.

    • loadFXML

      public void loadFXML(javafx.event.ActionEvent event, String resource) throws IOException
      Loads an FXML file given a provided resource. When loading ModifyPartView or ModifyProductView, the selected item has to be passed from the instance of MainViewController to an instance of either Modify View.
      Parameters:
      resource - String URL of the FXML filepath
      event - ID of the Button click which initiated a loadFXML method call.
      Throws:
      IOException - if FXML is not found. RUNTIME_ERROR A significant logical bug was created by the Modify Controllers which required the use of a FXMLLoader to receive the selection and index from the MainViewController. The inclusion of the cast type allowed for the Modify event handlers to use this method without instantiating their own loaders a minor behavior change.

    • Enter

      public void Enter(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent keyEvent) throws NullPointerException
      This event handler responds to any key pressed while using one of the Part or Product search bars. If the "ENTER" key is selected, then the System will collect the input text, attempt to match it as an integer to an existing Part (or Product depending on the source), if the parse fails, it is tried as a String. Null values returned will cause a "No Results Found" message, a partial text completion will select the first result displayed by the SortedList.
      Parameters:
      keyEvent - source object identifying which FXML object is being used.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If a search result returns "NULL" RUNTIME_ERROR System presents an error message if there is not a matching search result to the text inside the TextField Object. RUNTIME_ERROR When search results were empty, the system was still able to select a null item. This led to no error being returned FUTURE_ENHANCEMENT Currently this search relies on several branching if-statements. Implementing a data structure such as a stack could handle many of the checks which are performed at runtime and create a more legible function.
